movies.title: The Sinister Man
movies.plot: When a corpse is found in the Thames, the only clue is that the dead man was killed by a karate or judo expert.
movies.simplePlot: When a corpse is found in the Thames, the only clue is that the dead man was killed by a karate or judo expert.

biography.bio: Patrick Allen was born on March 17, 1927 in Nyasaland as John Keith Patrick Allen. He was an actor, known for Dial M for Murder (1954), Crane (1963) and Glencannon (1959). He was married to Lawson, Sarah. He died on July 28, 2006 in London, England.
biography.name: Patrick Allen

biography.bio: Gerald Andersen was born on April 28, 1910 in Muswell Hill, London, England as Gerald Schacke Andersen. He was an actor, known for Horrors of the Black Museum (1959), Napoleon's Day Out (1957) and Remember Jane (1955). He was married to Betty Cooper. He died on May 27, 1964 in Barnes, London.
biography.name: Gerald Andersen

biography.bio: Edward Atienza was born on January 27, 1924 in London, England. He was an actor, known for Pursuit of the Graf Spee (1956), Romanoff and Juliet (1961) and Say Hello to Yesterday (1971). He died on September 16, 2014.
biography.name: Edward Atienza

biography.bio: John Bentley was born on December 2, 1916 in Sparkhill, Birmingham, England. He was an actor, known for African Patrol (1957), Crossroads (1964) and Submarine Seahawk (1958). He was married to Patricia Smith. He died on August 13, 2009 in Petworth, West Sussex, England.
biography.name: John Bentley

biography.bio: Wilfrid Brambell was born on 22 March 1912, in Dublin, Ireland. His first acting experience was when he was aged just two when he entertained wounded soldiers returning from action during the First World War. On leaving school he worked part-time as a reporter for The Irish Times and part-time as an actor at the Abbey Theatre. In World War II he joined the British military forces entertainment organisation ENSA. On his return Wilfrid began performing with various repertory companies across the UK in Swansea, Bristol and Chesterfield. It was also during this time that he began breaking into films. His television career began in the 1950s, when he was cast in small roles in the BBC Television productions: "The Quatermass Experiment", "Nineteen Eighty-Four" and "Quatermass II". These roles earned him a reputation for playing old men, though he was only in her forties at the time. Wilfrid was just 49 when he first played Albert Steptoe. The role immediately launched him to fame and notoriety and made him into a national figure. His film work continued with a role in the 1962 Walt Disney film "In Search of the Castaways" and playing Paul McCartney's granddad in The Beatles "A Hard Day's Night". Steptoe and Son finished in 1974 after eight series and two hit spin-off films. Wilfrid and Co-Star Harry H. Corbett continued to revive the characters for special one off performances and events including a 1977 tour of Australia. He continued to take small roles in various television series and films during the late 1970s and 1980s before losing his battle against cancer on 18th January 1985.
biography.name: Wilfrid Brambell

biography.bio: Yvonne Buckingham was born in 1937 in Yorkshire, England. She is an actress, known for The Christine Keeler Story (1963), Our Man in Havana (1959) and Sapphire (1959).
biography.name: Yvonne Buckingham

biography.bio: Michael Deacon was born on March 6, 1937 in Lanarkshire, Scotland as Manus Docherty. He was an actor and writer, known for The Lord of the Rings (1978), A Kind of Loving (1962) and Antigone (1962). He died on December 26, 2000 in Denville Hall, Northwood, London, England.
biography.name: Michael Deacon

biography.bio: Jacqueline Ellis was born on June 21, 1934 as Jacqueline Sheelagh Ellis. She is an actress, known for Gutter Girls (1963), The Problem of Mary Winshaw (1962) and The Hi-Jackers (1963). She is married to Brian Heard. She was previously married to Griffith Davies and Jeffrey Bernard.
biography.name: Jacqueline Ellis

biography.bio: Keith Faulkner was born on July 25, 1939 in the USA. He is an actor, known for Tunes of Glory (1960), The Man in the Back Seat (1961) and Not at All (1962).
biography.name: Keith Faulkner

biography.bio: William Gaunt was born on April 3, 1937 in Pudsey, Yorkshire, England as William Charles Anthony Gaunt. He is an actor, known for Sergeant Cork (1963), No Place Like Home (1983) and The Champions (1968). He has been married to Carolyn Lyster since September 7, 1974. They have two children.
biography.name: William Gaunt

biography.bio: John Glyn-Jones was born on August 28, 1909 in London, England. He was an actor and producer, known for The Adventures of Hal 5 (1958), Waltz of the Toreadors (1962) and I'm All Right Jack (1959). He died on January 21, 1997 in Casablanca, Morocco.
biography.name: John Glyn-Jones

biography.bio: Peter Hager is an actor, known for Battle of Britain (1969), The Hiding Place (1975) and K.I.L. 1 (1962).
biography.name: Peter Hager

biography.bio: John made his acting debut at the Theatre Royal, Bournemouth. After spending a year in various reps. including Hastings, Watford and Eastbourne, he was conscripted into the Devon Yeomanry during the war and served in Italy and Sicily, but contracted hepatitis. He then became a member of the Army Bureau For Current Affairs - Play Unit, touring England, France and Germany. He then spent many years in theatre, before branching out into films and starring alongside David Niven and John Mills. He has also appeared in many TV roles.
biography.name: John Horsley

biography.bio: Burt Kwouk was born on July 18, 1930 in Warrington, Cheshire, England as Herbert Tsangtse Kwouk. He was an actor, known for Goldfinger (1964), Le baiser mortel du dragon (2001) and The Pink Panther Strikes Again (1976). He was married to Caroline Tebbs. He died on May 24, 2016 in Hampstead, London, England.
biography.name: Burt Kwouk

biography.bio: Arnold Lee is an actor, known for Hardware (1990), Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi (1983) and A Majority of One (1960).
biography.name: Arnold Lee
